Primal Path : Choose a path that shapes the nature of your rage.
thirdLevel.pathBerserkerDescription: The Path of the Berserker is a pth of untrammeled fury, slick with blood. As you enter the berserker's rage, you thrill in the chaos of battle, heedless of your own health or well-being
pathBerserkerFeatures: Frenzy : For the duration of your rage you can make a single melee weapon attack as a bonus action on each of your turns after this one. When your rage ends, you suffer one level of exhaustion.
thirdLevel.pathTotemDescription: The Path of the Totem Warrior is a spiritual journey, as the barbarian accepts a spirit animal as guide, protector and ispiration. In battle, your totem spirit fills you with supernatural might, adding magical fuel to your barbarian rage.
pathTotemFeatures: Spirit Seeker : You gain the ability to cast the Beast Sense and Speak with Animals spells, but only as rituals.
Totem Spirit : When you adopt this path, you choose a totem spirit. You must make or acquire a physical totem object that incorporates a physical trait of the totem animal. Choose one out of :
Bear : While raging, you have resistance to all damage except psychic damage.
Eagle : While raging and not wearing heavy armour, other creatures have disadvantage on opportuinty attack rolls against you and you can use the Dash action as a bonus action on your turn.
Wolf : While raging, your friends have advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature within 5 feet of you that is hostile to you.

features: Bardic Inspiration : Can inspire others. Give another creature a d6 inspiration die to be used within the next 10 minutes
Bardic Inspiration : Can inspire others. Give another creature a d6 inspiration die to be used within the next 10 minutes
Jack of all Trades : Can add half your prof bonus to any ability check
Song of Rest : At the end of a short rest, friendly creatures that heard your song regain 1d6 hit points
Divine Domain: Choose one aspect of your deity's portfolio to emphasize, and you are granted powers related to that domain
firstLevel.knowledgeDomainDescription: Value learning and understanding. Your God will encourage you to discover the secrets of the multiverse.
knowledgeDomainFeatures: Blessings of Knowledge: Learn two languages of your choice. You also become proficient in two of the folling skills. Arcana, History, Nature or Religion. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of those skills
firstLevel.lifeDomainDescription: Life domain focuses on the vibrant positive energy that sustains all life. The gods of life promote vitality and health through healing the sick and wounded, caring for those in need and driving away the forces of death and undeath.
lifeDomainFeatures: Bonus Proficiency: You gain proficiency with heavy armour
Disciple of Life: Whenever you use a spell of 1st level or higher to restore hit points to a creature, the creature regains additional hit points equal to 2 + the spell's level.
firstLevel.lightDomainDescription: Gods of Light promote the ideals of rebirth and renewal, truth, vigilance and beauty, often using the symbol of the sun. Clerics of light are enlightened souls infused with radiance and the power of their gods' discerning vision, charged with chasing away lies and burning away darkness
lightDomainFeatures: Bonus Cantrip : You gain the Light cantrip if you don't already know it.
Warding Flare : When you are attacked by another creature, you can impose disadvantage on their attack. You can use this feature equal to your WIS modifier. You gain all slots back after a long rest.
firstLevel.natureDomainDescription: Nature clerics take a more active role than druids in advancing the interests of a particular nature god. These clerics might hunt the evil monstrosities that despoil the woodlands, bless the harvest of the faithful, or wither the crops of those who anger their gods.
natureDomainFeatures: Acolyte of Nature : You learn one druid cantrip of your choice. You also gain proficiency in one of the following skils of your choice : Animal Handling, Nature or Survival.
Bonus Proficiency : You gain proficiency with heavy armour
firstLevel.tempestDomainDescription: Gods whose portfolios include the Tempest domain govern storms, seas and sky. Tempest gods send their clerics to inspire fear in the common folk, either to keep those folk on the path of righteousness or to encourage them to offer sacrifices of propitiation to ward off divine wrath
tempestDomainFeatures: Bonus Proficiencies : You gain proficiency with martial weapons and heavy armour

Wrath of the Storm : When a creature within 5 feet of you that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to cause the creature to make a DEX saving throw. The creature takes 2d8 lightning or thunder damage on a failed saving throw, and half as much damage on a successful one. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your WIS modifier. You gain all uses after a long rest.
firstLevel.trickeryDomainDescription: Gods of trickery are mischief-makers and instigators who stand as a constant challenge to the accepted order among both gods and mortals. Their clerics are a disruptie force in the world, puncturing pride, mocking tyrants, stealing from the rich, freeing captives, and flouting hollow traditions. They prefer subterfuge, pranks, deception and theft rather than direct confrontation.
trickeryDomainFeatures: Blessing of the Trickster : You can use your action to touch a willing creature to give it advantage on Stealth checks. This blessing lasts for 1 hour or until you use this feature again.
firstLevel.warDomainDescription: The gods of war watch over warriors and reward them for their great deeds. The clerics of such gods excel in battle, inspiring others to fight the good fight or offering acts of violence as prayers.
warDomainFeatures: Bonus Proficiency : You gain proficiency with martial weapons and heavy armour

War Priest : When you use the attack action, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your WIS modifier. You gain all uses when you finish a long rest.

features: Druidic : You know Druidic, a secret language, and use it to leave hidden messages. You and others who know this language automatically spot such a message. Othes spot its presence with a successful DC 15 perception check but cannot decipher it without magic.

Spellcasting : You can prepare a list of druid spells that are available to you to cast, choosing from the Druid spell list. To cast one of these spells, you must expand a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expanded spell slots after a long rest.

Wild Shape : You can use your action to assume the shape of a beast that you have seen before. You can use this feature twice. You regain expanded uses when you finish a short or long rest. You can transform into any beast that has a challenge rating of 1/4 or lower that doesn't have a flying or swimming speed e.g a Wolf.
Druid Circle : You choose to identify with a circle of druids : the Circle of the Land or the Circle of the Moon.
